name: 10 Question Sports Quiz: Formula One Racing |   Motor Sports

questions.text: In 1989, Zakspeed was the first team to use Yamaha engines in F1. Which team was the last?
questions.explanation:
Arrows.

	Damon Hill joined Arrows in 1997 from the Williams team, but he only drove for 1 year before moving to Jordan.

questions.text: Who partnered Martin Brundle at Ligier in 1993?
questions.explanation:
Mark Blundell.

	Blundell and Brundle drove together in the 2011 Daytona 24 Hours.

questions.text: Who missed the entire 1952 due to injury?
questions.explanation:
Juan Manuel Fangio.

	Fangio never drove in 1952, thanks to a broken neck. Piero Taruffi won the first race of the season.

questions.text: At which event did Alain Prost score his final F1 victory?
questions.explanation:
Germany 1993.

	After winning the championship in 1993, Prost retired from F1 and Ayrton Senna took his place for 1994.

questions.text: Which Italian driver set a record for having the most race starts without scoring a point?
questions.explanation:
Luca Badoer.

	Luca later drove for Ferrari for 2 races in 2009, in place of the injured Felipe Massa, but was then replaced by Giancarlo Fisichella.

questions.text: Which team did Ayrton Senna make his debut with in 1984?
questions.explanation:
Toleman.

	He would later move to Lotus, then McLaren, and then to Williams for 1994, where he was killed at Imola.

questions.text: Lewis Hamilton won his first Canadian GP in 2009.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Hamilton won his first race in Montreal in 2007.

questions.text: When did the BBC start showing coverage of all races?
questions.explanation:
1978.

	The first race that the BBC covered was in Canada 1978, which Gilles Villeneuve won.

questions.text: Which of these drivers in 2008, set a record for the most career starts?
questions.explanation:
Rubens Barrichello.

	Rubens broke this record at the 2008 Turkish GP while driving for Williams.

questions.text: Which driver won his first F1 race in 2009?
questions.explanation:
Mark Webber.

	Webber won in Germany, beating Vettel and Massa.
